author: Michael Larabel
description: Back in June it was announced by Canonical that for the Ubuntu 25.10 release they would be raising the RISC-V baseline to the RVA23 profile even with barely any available RISC-V platforms supporting that newer RISC-V profile. That change is still going ahead and leaves Ubuntu 25.10 on RISC-V currently only supporting the QEMU virtualized target...
title: Ubuntu 25.10's Only Supported RISC-V Platform: QEMU Virtualization

author: Michael Larabel
description: With Linux 6.17 expected for release this weekend, the Linux 6.18 merge window will in turn kick-off for its usual two week dance. Here is a look at some of the features on our radar that are expected to be merged for Linux 6.18, which is also likely to be the 2025 LTS kernel version...
title: Features Expected For Linux 6.18: File-System Improvements, Sheaves, New Drivers & More Perf

author: Michael Larabel
description: Vulkan 1.4.328 is now available as the latest specification update to this high performance graphics and compute API from The Khronos Group...
title: Vulkan 1.4.328 Published With Copy Memory Indirect Extension

author: Michael Larabel
description: The Linux 6.17 kernel is tracking well for its planned stable release on Sunday. Here is a look back at some of the most interesting changes to find with this next kernel version...
title: Linux 6.17 Gets Ready For Release With Intel Panther Lake & More Performance

author: Michael Larabel
description: I noticed a number of benchmarks failing to run on Ubuntu 25.10 this week with reported checksum errors on the files... I quickly realized it's due to the recent Rust Coreutils transition for Ubuntu 25.10 causing some major breakage for those relying on Makeself archives...
title: Ubuntu 25.10's Move To Rust Coreutils Is Causing Major Breakage For Some Executables

author: Michael Larabel
description: After being on a hiatus for more than one year and going through several rounds of Habana Labs driver maintainers due to Intel layoffs, there finally is some updated "habanalabs" AI accelerator kernel driver code slated to go into the upcoming Linux 6.18 kernel cycle. There is some new feature work but still no Gaudi 3 support for the upstream Linux kernel...
title: Intel Returns To Working On The Habana Labs AI Accelerator Linux Driver

author: Michael Larabel
description: Just a friendly reminder that our autumn promotion is ending in a few days for those wishing to join Phoronix Premium at a discounted rate. Less than 1% of readers currently do so for helping to support the site and its Linux hardware testing and open-source news operations over the past 21 years. Joining Phoronix Premium gets you ad-free access, multi-page articles on a single page, custom forum avatar support, and other benefits all while helping for operations to continue during this difficult period for the web/ad industry...
title: Time Is Running Out On Our Autumn Deal To Help Support Linux Hardware Reviews

author: Michael Larabel
description: The Linux 6.18 kernel is bringing a new patch to benefit those using the decade-old AMD Bulldozer processors and wanting to make use of Linux's X86_NATIVE_CPU build option for enhancing performance in some areas by optimizing the kernel build for your particular processor/ISA capabilities...
title: Linux 6.18 Landing Patch For Old AMD Bulldozer CPUs With XOP Instruction Set

author: Michael Larabel
description: A new feature merged this week for the Intel Mesa compiler code for their ANV Vulkan and Iris Gallium3D drivers is support for Stochastic Rounding...
title: Mesa 25.3 Intel Driver Lands Support For Stochastic Rounding

author: Michael Larabel
description: Overnight the Linux PC vendor System76 released their long-awaited Pop!_OS 24.04 LTS Beta operating system along with the beta milestone of their COSMIC desktop environment...
title: System76 Releases Pop!_OS 24.04 LTS Beta Alongside COSMIC Desktop Beta
